title: Introduction
text: get sequence, first subset onekp@table contains species want. several ways . can use normal tools subsetting table directly, e.g. onekp also builtin tools taxonomic selection chosen studies want, can retrieve protein transcript FASTA files: download files temporary directory. Alternatively, may set directory dir argument. downloaded protein FASTA files extension .faa DNA files extension .fna. basename file 1KP 4-letter code.
code: onekp@table <- subset(onekp@table, family == 'Nymphaeaceae') # filter by species name ('species' column of onekp@table) filter_by_species(onekp, 'Pinus radiata') #> OneKP object #> Slot "table": metadata for 0 transcriptomes from 0 species #> Slot "links": map of file names from "table" to URLs  # filter by species NCBI taxon ID  ('tax_id' column of onekp@table) filter_by_species(onekp, 3347) #> OneKP object #> Slot "table": metadata for 0 transcriptomes from 0 species #> Slot "links": map of file names from "table" to URLs  # filter by clade name scientific name (get all data for the Brassicaceae family) filter_by_clade(onekp, 'Brassicaceae') #> OneKP object #> Slot "table": metadata for 0 transcriptomes from 0 species #> Slot "links": map of file names from "table" to URLs  # filter by clade NCBI taxon ID filter_by_clade(onekp, 3700) #> OneKP object #> Slot "table": metadata for 0 transcriptomes from 0 species #> Slot "links": map of file names from "table" to URLs download_peptides(filter_by_clade(onekp, 'Brassicaceae')) download_nucleotides(filter_by_clade(onekp, 'Brassicaceae'))

what: Retrieve Data from the 1000 Plants Initiative (1KP)
title: Retrieve Data from the 1000 Plants Initiative (1KP)
text: 1000 Plants initiative (1KP) provides transcriptome sequences 1000 plants diverse lineages. onekp allows researchers plant genomics transcriptomics access dataset simple R interface. metadata transcriptome project scraped 1KP project website. metadata includes species, tissue, research group sequence sample. onekp leverages taxonomy program taxizedb, local database version taxize package, allow filtering metadata taxonomic group (entered either taxon name NCBI ID). raw nucleotide translated peptide sequence can downloaded full, filtered, table transcriptome projects.

title: Retrieve Data from the 1000 Plants Initiative (1KP)
text: data may also accessed directly CyVerse (previously iPlant). CyVerse efficiently distributes data using iRODS data system. approach preferable high-throughput cases iRODS already play. , accessing data straight source CyVerse stable scraping project website. However, onekp R package generally easier use (iRODS dependency CyVerse API) offers powerful filtering solutions.

text: Retrieve protein gene transcript FASTA files two 1KP transcriptomes: create following directory: onekp can also filter species names, taxon ids, clade. get protein sequences species Brassicaceae:
code: onekp <- retrieve_onekp() seqs <- filter_by_code(onekp, c('URDJ', 'ROAP')) download_peptides(seqs, 'oneKP/pep') download_nucleotides(seqs, 'oneKP/nuc') oneKP  ├── nuc   │   ├── ROAP.fna  │   └── URDJ.fna  └── pep      ├── ROAP.faa      └── URDJ.faa # filter by species name filter_by_species(onekp, 'Pinus radiata')  # filter by species NCBI taxon ID filter_by_species(onekp, 3347)  # filter by clade name scientific name (get all data for the Brassicaceae family) filter_by_clade(onekp, 'Brassicaceae')  # filter by clade NCBI taxon ID filter_by_clade(onekp, 3700) onekp <- retrieve_onekp() seqs <- filter_by_clade(onekp, 'Brassicaceae') download_peptides(seqs, 'oneKP/pep') download_nucleotides(seqs, 'oneKP/nuc')
